rules.name: Drought Risk for Rain-fed Farms
rules.explanation: Low rainfall forecast combined with rain-fed farming creates high drought risk

rules.name: Heavy Rainfall and Flood Risk
recommendations: Avoid fertilizer application before heavy rain
Cover exposed soil with mulch or cover crops
Move livestock to higher ground if applicable
rules.explanation: Heavy rainfall expected, increasing flood and erosion risk

rules.name: Clay Soil Waterlogging Risk
recommendations: Consider raised beds for sensitive crops
rules.explanation: Clay soil retains water longer, increasing waterlogging risk during heavy rain

rules.name: Heat Stress Warning
recommendations: Water crops early morning or late evening
Provide shade for sensitive crops if possible
rules.explanation: High temperatures can cause heat stress to crops and livestock

rules.name: Teff Drought Resilience
recommendations: Adjust planting window to optimal timing
rules.explanation: Teff requires careful water management during drought conditions

rules.name: Optimal Planting Window
recommendations: Current conditions are favorable for planting
Monitor weather for next 7 days before planting
rules.explanation: Weather conditions are optimal for planting activities
